website_summaries.verdict: It’s pricier than some others, but its build quality helps to justify the cost.
pros: Contains all of the items you need to replace the filter and related components
High quality gasket helps to prevent leaks
Matches up nicely with quite a few different vehicle makes and models for a perfect fit
cons: Adjusting the torque to avoid leaks can be tricky during installation

customer_reviews.title: Works well with the 45RFE, 545RFE and the 65RFE 4WD pan or the newer trucks with the common pan.
customer_reviews.text: I had an 04 Ram 1500 Hemi with the 545RFE 2WD. This filter set (sump filter) won't fit but this fits the newer version 65RFE transmission with the deeper common pan. My current truck is a 2015 Ram 1500 Hemi with the 65 RFE. The gasket is a rubber type of gasket that holds the 8mm pan bolts nicely for easy installation. Be sure to use a Torx T-25 on the sump (plate) filter. The plate filter comes with a small round seal that you can press in with a 3/4 socket with extension tapping it in place with a hammer. Can't go wrong with a Wix filter.
customer_reviews.author: American

customer_reviews.title: Complete kit
customer_reviews.text: Contains everything you need to complete the filter change. For my 2010 Ram with 545RFE, the spin on filter takes 84 in/lb of torque. Make sure you torque it as required by OEM. There have been occurrences of the spin on filter coming of. The main filter is easy to change, just make sure to remove the small O-ring seal from the old filter from the case.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 06 Jeep Commander Limited Hemi. So far so good! Gasket works great, with no leaks, and it's much less of a hassle to deal with than rtv, especially since it's a pain to get the pan back on the commander (very little wiggle room). Filters seems to be doing their job just fine too. Do yourself a favor and buy the Dorman replacement pan for $35 that has a drain plug to make future drains a lot less messy. Overall I highly recommend these filter and gasket kit!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2005 Durango 5.7L 4WD 545RFE
customer_reviews.text: This kit fit my 2005 Durango perfectly. Note this kit is for the 4WD transmission "deep pan". For the 2WD version you'll need the "shallow pan". The kit has everything you need - the main filter, spin on return filter, and a new gasket. I installed this kit a couple of years ago and it has been great. Ordering a new one now to change the filters while the pan is dropped to change the solenoid pack.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Very good product, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: This filter set was purchased to service the automatic transmission, 545RFE, of a 2004 Jeep Grand Cherokee, 4.7 liter. The filters and the attachments are very good fits, EXACTLY LIKE ORIGINAL PARTS, all made like you expected for a not real simple job. This type of service should be made by experienced mechanics, fitment and proper installation are critical and failure to do so will result in transmission damage!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Great filters, wrong gasket
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these filters for my 2011 Ram 1500. I needed to drop the valve body and so I replaced the filters too. Long story short, the filters were correct but the pan gasket was completely wrong. Luckily I had some rtv to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D

customer_reviews.title: Works great on an 02 4x4 Durango
customer_reviews.text: This worked great on my 02 4x4 Durango. The quality of the parts appeared to be just as good as the OEM filter in place and the fitment was exactly the same. I bought the truck used. We drove it for about 3 weeks before I could get the parts and time lined up to do the trans fluid change. Right before I could get to it we got a check engine light for low or burned trans fluid, and it could have been worse. I changed out the fluid that was well overdue and the light went out and we haven't had any problems. I'm happy with this kit and will use it again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit and replacement for factory filters.
customer_reviews.text: Installed these on my 2007 Dodge 2500 with the 6.7 liter Cummins Diesel. Everything fit perfectly but as my transmission oil pan was factory sealed with RTV silicone I elected to use that again and not the supplied gasket. Just because.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelJT

customer_reviews.title: Was not the correct filter.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t receive the correct filter. I was told this product fit my vehicle. Shipping was fast however when I received my package the filter was for a 4x4 and my vehicle is a 2x4. So I had to run to advance auto and get the correct filter.
customer_reviews.author: michael m.

customer_reviews.title: Works Well in the 65RFE
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in a 2012 Ram 1500 with the 65RFE transmission. I have put about 700 miles on it so far without a problem. I will mention that I did not use the included gasket, instead I went with the manufacturer-recommended oil-resistant RTV. Everything seems to be working as it should, so I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andy92

customer_reviews.title: Works for 03 Ram 2500 5.7l
customer_reviews.text: I looked for a filter for my trans on Parts geek and the product number for this kit came up. Bought it through Amazon because it was cheaper and everything works just fine. Gasket was nice quality and fit perfect too.
customer_reviews.author: Colten G.

customer_reviews.title: Fluid change
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Mopar fluid and the Wix filter kit and had a local independent shop do the install for $170. Worth it to have someone else get messy and ensure it does not leak. They used 7.9 quarts of fluid in my 2011 Ram 1500 4x4.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Two of three parts was not good enough.
customer_reviews.text: Wrong pancake filter. The rest was correct. I live out In the country and just can’t run to the auto parts store real quick. Once I got the vehicle in the air and the pan removed, fluid drained out and was doing the reinstalls I found out the pancake filter was not the right one. WIX Quality Control messed this up. Amazon Is making it better but it was a huge PITA caused by WIX.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Mayle

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!! This is not a Wix filter quality is horrible I think the item I received was counterfeit item china knockoff I returned had to get one from auto parts store in town also filter has a hole at top that wasn’t on OEM or auto parts store one
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: The kit looks to be good quality although I have not installed it yet but I'm sure everything will go smooth. I bought for a 2007 Dodge Durango 4.7 fex fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L

customer_reviews.title: For my 2004 Durango 5.7
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and installed it on my 2004 Dodge Durango SLT 5.7 Hemi, kit is complete, all need is ATF-4 trans fluid, I used Valvoline fluid, 6.5 quarts.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: Best filters made.
customer_reviews.text: Wix has always been my choice for automotive filters. There was a product comparison on-line that proved what I have always known. Wix makes the best filters!
customer_reviews.author: Michael central Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Has the pan gasket and filters
customer_reviews.text: The filters fit and this comes with a pan gasket so don't have to mess w factory rtv gasket again - fluid extractor is a help to install this as lots of fluid in trans - 2008 jeep hemi - wix always high quality like their oil filters
customer_reviews.author: No1Dad

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well.
customer_reviews.text: Installed as directed. Put over 1000 miles since and it seems to be working as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H. Morton

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Install was easy but messy seems to be working fine after 5k miles.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Good set except you have to push up on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Good set except you have to push up on the filter material at the oil pan inlet or it will clog the entry way. MADE IN CHINA.. It has a good rubber gasket so you don't need sealant, just 105 inch pounds torque on pan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wix filter fits, if you do your homework
customer_reviews.text: arrived on time, fit just fine. You have to read description carefully and properly identify your transmission to get the right kit.
customer_reviews.author: David Wahl

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but one filter was made in Mexico and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but one filter was made in Mexico and one in China. I did not use the gasket (used RTV instead). Both of my old Chrysler filters were made in USA. I will spend a little bit extra to buy American next time.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: not all parts included
customer_reviews.text: this product does not come with both filters as pictured only the main not the canister filter. Hopefully this helps keep someone out of situation i was put in
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement and matched what I took off the truck
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to perform a well overdue filter/tranny fluid swap out. Parts fit perfect. Truck shifts much better.
customer_reviews.author: John Herron

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked as required and fit my 2012 Ram 3500 4WD perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 68RFE needs filtered often if you tow
customer_reviews.text: Everything I needed to do the job right. I did replace the plastic nipple that comes in the spin on filter with a billet one that I purchased from an aftermarket transmission vendor. Stock Plastic nipples are prone to crack and break.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Right Filters - Wrong Gasket
customer_reviews.text: The filters were identical to the original ones and fit perfectly. The transmission pan gasket did not fit, and was for a much smaller pan.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph D. Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect, must follow instructions especially with seal install. Gasket is thick and soft, holds oil perfectly, no leaks.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect, must follow instructions especially with seal install. Gasket is thick and soft, holds oil perfectly, no leaks.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Parts were correct and fit perfect. 2003 Dodge Ram 1500, 5.7L 4x4. 545RFE trans.

customer_reviews.text: Worked great and easy to put on. Fit my 00 Dodge Durango

customer_reviews.title: This is the 4x4 Filter
customer_reviews.text: This does not fit the 2WD Shallow pan trannys. It has a longer sump pickup that will not allow you to install the pan. The 4x4 pan has a deep area to allow for this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two for two vehicles. One kit was missing the screw on filter the other was missing the gasket. All WIX has to do is tape the box.
customer_reviews.author: R. Clemmons

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for my Jeep Liberty 2002 transmission. This ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my Jeep Liberty 2002 transmission. This was a lot of work at the time and messy. But I got it done all on my own. Transmission running smoother than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Damaged filter in box
customer_reviews.text: One of the filters came damaged, shipping box wasn't damaged
customer_reviews.author: Sergiy Kuzin

customer_reviews.title: Kit does the job right and saved my trany!
customer_reviews.text: Worth it! Nice kit with good gasket and both filters get changed at once!
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Wix 58843 Filter Kit
customer_reviews.text: I love to use WIX filters on my Jeep. They're relatively cheap and one of the best (scientifically proven) filter companies out there, consistently beating out the more expensive filter companies (I'm looking at you FRAM). The kit comes with everything you need for a transmission fluid swap, at least on the filter, gaskets, and seals end of it. Just to clarify for those who may be wondering, the difference between this and the 58846 kit is that this, the 58843 kit is for 4WD models, while the 58846 is for 2WD models. I have a 99 Grand Cherokee 4.7 with the 545RFE.
customer_reviews.author: mycreativename

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just like OEM. Very happy with the products. Gasket was very well made. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Absolutely no leaking from the gasket
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my 2005 Jeep Grand Cherokee Limited, 5.7 Hemi. Works great! Absolutely no leaking from the gasket.
customer_reviews.author: Rex W. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: high quality replacement filters
customer_reviews.text: Filters fit fine. I did not use the pan gasket, just Permatex transmission gasket sealer. be careful with the seal.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Haskin

customer_reviews.title: Bad thread on return filter
customer_reviews.text: Gasket worked well. Sump filter worked well. Spin-on return filter had a damaged thread right out of the packaging - had to go to AAP to replace it, since I needed the car back on the road.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These seemed to improve shifting in my 2007 Ram 1500 with 171,000 miles

customer_reviews.text: Same/better quality than the oem Mopar from the stealership, but much cheaper. I like WIX filters and use them wherever I can. Used this kit during my recent transmission service on my diesel CRD Jeep Liberty 4x4, with the 545RFE transmission.

customer_reviews.title: 05 dodge RAM 2500 4x4 hemi 545rfe
customer_reviews.text: quality made wix filter set. looks almost identical to mopar. filters were made in different countries. will buy again. I didn't use the pan gasket, get some mopar rtv-atf its really good stuff. install the sump filter seal with a socket and hammer to tap into place. I also installed a jegs brand drain plug kit for much easier servicing in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jake - Eagle Point, OR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit fo 05 Ram Hemi 4x4 QC. Nothing else to say. Works great!

customer_reviews.title: Good kit, good fit
customer_reviews.text: Good kit, good fit, no problems during install. Wish all the pieces were US made like they should have been. Hard to go wrong with WIX brand!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dawes

customer_reviews.title: Verify Your Gasket Size
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have verified my gasket before I pulled off my pan. The gasket supplied was half the size of the pan which meant I had to make a run into my local hardware store and buy another gasket for $20 when I had already purchased this for $45. Not very happy the gasket didn't fit. The filters seem to work but I won't be ordering this kit again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, Gasket did not leak,  I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, Gasket did not leak. Eric O from South Main Auto Repair has an excellent Youtube video on how to install it called "Dodge Dakota - Transmission Service - 45RFE & 545RFE" I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: I would replace this seal with the new filters as the old one looked like it was no sealing well
customer_reviews.text: The filters work so far. The seal that comes with the main filter is a pain to remove from the valve body. Had to cut the old seal out as there is little room. I would replace this seal with the new filters as the old one looked like it was no sealing well.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: great buy for the money much less than Amsoils same filter would buy again for sure easy to place order

I will be returning this product as I refuse to put rusty material inside my transmission. VERY Disappointed as WIX filters were always recommended to me in such high regard from the people that use them. Should've just went with the Mopar filters for a little more money.

customer_reviews.title: OEM vs This WIX = OEM Victory
customer_reviews.text: Made in China in Mexico looks cheap. Normally I am a fan of Wix but this simply did not look like quality. I went to dealer and bought OEM and they look so much different. The OEM is made in USA which I prefer too. Sorry WIX I cannot force you to make a quality American part but I can choose a part that is. Personal preference but this part I suggest OEM.
